ovdesc.p: A generic application program within T24 which controls all phantom and interactive jobs including the T24 Transaction Server and ATM interface.
This program sets up all common logic required for all phantom/interactive jobs. Processing is handled by the RUN.ROUTINE, which may be a standard product for example:
GTS.CLIENT - required to run GTS ATM.CONTROL.USW - U/Switchware ATM interface
or may be a regional/site specific routine.
The RUN.ROUTINE must handle the starting and stopping correctly whether run interactively or as a background process. A Phantom process is stopped by entering STOP in the PHANT.STOP.REQ field.

The application allows information to be passed to the run routine via the fields RUN.PARAM and RUN.VALUE. RUN.PARAM allows an indicator recognised by the RUN.ROUTINE to be supplied, the associated value is passed in the RUN.VALUE. Product documentation should identify valid options.

Specifies whether the system should attempt to automatically shut down the EB.PHANTOM process prior to running the batch.

If this field is set to Y the system will try to close the phantom process if the STATUS is ACTIVE. If the process cannot be closed the system cannot run the end of day. In order to correct this situation the operator should determine whether the process is actually ACTIVE, if not the STATUS flag should be reset manually.
Optional field, valid value Y.
Specifies whether the process should be automatically started on completion of the batch process.

Any process with this field set to Y and RUN.MODE set to INTERACTIVE will be restarted when the system is set back to on-line status. All processes can also be restarted by running RESTART.EB.PHANTOM.
Optional Input, valid input Y
